Description: The time where the subject start to recording his EDA.
Proccess: This dateTime is calculated from the start_date_time column of the Mindfulness session csv file. /n The value from the csv file get through few converting steps: /n 1. converted to datetime.  /n  2. If there is not time zone in the value then +00:00 is added to the end of the value. /n 3. Then the timezone converted to Israel time zone (+02:00) /n 4. Then the addition of the time zone is dropped. /n /n If the measure time is between 00:00 and 05:00 then the date is assigned to the previous date.
File: {subject} EDA.csv

Description: The time where the subject finish to recording his EDA.
Proccess: This dateTime is calculated from the end_date_time column of the Mindfulness session csv file. /n The value from the csv file get through few converting steps: /n 1. converted to datetime. /n 2. If there is not time zone in the value then +00:00 is added to the end of the value. /n 3. Then the timezone converted to Israel time zone (+02:00) /n 4. Then the addition of the time zone is dropped. /n /n If the measure time is between 00:00 and 05:00 then the date is assigned to the previous date.
File: {subject} EDA.csv

Description: The duration of the measure in seconds as being estimated by the Fitbit watch at the time of the recording.

This file sliced by the dates of the subjects dates and the measure start and end time.

Proccess: The label of the specific sleep feature. /n The sleep features that are currently available are "pre-sleep" and 'post-sleep', /n they are defined as: /n  pre-sleep - if the specific minute is within a range of one hour before the valid sleep. /n  Post-sleep - if the specific minute is within one hour after the valid sleep.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: The label of the specific activity value. /n The activity values that are currently available are 'sleeping', 'in_bed', 'awake', and 'unknown'. /n they defined as: /n sleeping - minutes in the time between the start of sleep time and end of sleep time. /n in_bed - minutes in the time between the bed start time and bed end time. /n awake - minutes that are not labeled as sleep or rest. /n unknown - minutes that we have no heart rate samples from /n and or /n we can't determine correctly when the sleep start time was or ended. (mainly due to missing data)
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: The label of the specific activity value. /n The activity values that are currently available are 'sleeping', 'in_bed', 'awake', and 'unknown'. /n they defined as: /n sleeping - minutes in the time between the start of sleep time and end of sleep time. /n The activity values that are currently available are 'sleep', 'rest', 'awake', 'unknown', 'low_activity', 'high_activity', and 'med_activity'. They defined as: /n Sleep - minutes in the time between the start of sleep time and the end of sleep time. /n Rest - minutes between bed start time and bed end time /n and or /n minutes where there is no steps data and the mode is awake. /n Awake - minutes that are not labeled as sleep nor rest. /n Unknown - minutes that we have no heart rate samples from /n  and or /n we can't determine correctly when the sleep start time was or ended. (mainly due to missing data) /n low_activity - minutes where the subject was awake and his steps value was between 1 to 9 per minute. /n med_activity  - minutes where the subject was awake and his steps value was between 10 to 49 per minute. /n high_activity  - minutes where the subject was awake and his step value was more than 50 per minute.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: Label of 10_min_pre_high_activity or " " as the only values.ÊThe label will appear on minutes that are 10 minutes pre the high_activity starts.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: Label 10_min_post_high_activity or " " as the only values.ÊThe label will appear on minutes that are identified as 10 minutes post the high_activity appeared.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: Label whether the minute can be labeled as one of the activity values described above or whetherÊthe minute is 10 minutes before or after high_activity.ÊIn addition, an "Invalid sleep" label was added for minutes where the sleep is invalid.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: False where the feature is sleep and the sleep was identified as not valid in the sleep all subjects csv file.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: True if the row is identified as a weekend by this logic: /n 1. First, the code looks to Thursday in the date range of the experiment. /n 2. If there is valid sleep data from this date, if there is valid sleep data on Saturday, then: /n - Weekend starts at the end of Thursday's sleep and ends at the end of Saturday's sleep. /n 3. If there is valid sleep data from this date, if there is no valid sleep data on Saturday, then: /n The weekend starts at the end of Thursday's sleep and ends on Sunday at the subject's mean sleep end time. /n 4. If there is no valid sleep data for this date, if there is valid sleep data for Sathurday then: /n The weekend starts on Thursday at the time of the mean end of sleep of this subject and ends at the end of Saturday's sleep. /n 5. If there is no valid sleep data for this date and there is no valid sleep data for Sathurday then: /n -  Weekend starts on Thursday at the time of the mean end sleep of this subject and /n end on Sunday at the mean sleep end time of the subject /n
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: False if the z_score value of this row is above 2.7.

Proccess: False if the bpmMean value is below the 25 percentile or above the 75 percentile of the feature in the specific row.
File: {subject} Heart Rate and Steps and Sleep Aggregated.csv

Proccess: These indices measure the regulation of the subject's sleep from day to day. /n The formula found in this article /n https://www.jmir.org/2018/6/e210/#figure5 /n  /n The formula is: /n 1. Take the Mode column from the heart rate steps sleep aggregated of the subject. /n 2. Rename the sleeping value to -1, and in_bed and awake to 1, and assign nan where the value is unknown. /n 3. Shift the minutes of the current day to the next day so that they are parallel to each other. Alias the new column of the shifted values as 24h_lag_Mode. /n 4. remove the residual minutes of the next day. /n 5. multiply the renamed values of the Mode column and the shifted column. To get the same mode as 1 and a different mode as -1 (sleeping * sleeping = -1 * -1 & awake * sleeping = 1 * -1). /n  6. get the sleep_regulatory index as: /n (sum of the values after multiplication / total values in each row of the Mode | 24h_lag_Mode) /n (sum of the values after multiplication / total values in each row of the Mode | 24h_lag_Mode) MINUS 0.5) MULTIPLY by 200.
File: *(Full Week/ No Weekends) Summary of Heart Rate Metrics By Activity.csv

Proccess: Each day, these features are calculated for all the features in this subject's heart rate, steps, and sleep aggregated CSV file. /n /n This feature is calculated as: /n ((the bpm mean of this feature - the median bpm of this feature) *3)  /n  divided by /n  specific feature bpm std /n /n If the day is the first day of the experiment, only the sleep features will be calculated. /n It will not be considered if the row is identified as an outlier in the heart rate, steps, and sleep aggregated CSV file. /n Also, if it's not the first date and this is the excluded weekend file, then weekend values will not be calculated. /n /n This feature will not been calculate for sleep features !
File: {subject} Metrics of Heart Rate By Activity *(exclude_weekends).csv

Proccess: Each day, these features are calculated for all the features in this subject's heart rate, steps, and sleep aggregated CSV file. /n /n The percentage of minutes on the specific day the subject was in the specific feature. /n If the day is the first day of the experiment, only the sleep features will be calculated. /n It will not be considered if the row is identified as an outlier in the heart rate, steps, and sleep aggregated CSV file. /n Also, if it's not the first date and this is the excluded weekend file, then weekend values will not be calculated. /n /n This feature will not be calculated for sleep features!
File: {subject} Metrics of Heart Rate By Activity *(exclude_weekends).csv
